intro: Ditrichanthus seemannii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure, which bloom from spring to summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
